industrial loans well they are giving

percent based on weakly fed data now
this is down from six point four percent
pays for all of last year and peak rates
around eight percent in mid-2016 this is

isn't getting out there the banks aren't
Loen loaning and the slowdown is

nearly 50 percent lower than the seventh
7% growth notched at the start of the

everyone's looking at this
why is this happening this makes no

the economy is deteriorating retail is

unemployment is an illusion and
corporations right now well guess what
they're not making the profits they're

so much retail space
they're not expanding so we're seeing a

and it's not just for commercial and

remember the central bank their product

further to more and more people to more

and they make it sound like it's a

people using their credit cards it's

there's a problem right now since 2008

well they took that to the edge here and

this redevelopment of the credit scores
well
already in process as three major credit

represents them this is what they're

how many Americans is this going to

we can see right now this is the next

Falls but it's a lot less than last year
and we see right now that in
be wary the US Treasury brought in total

190 billion expected now for the fiscal

virtually identical to the three hundred

less about 2.2 percent now something

following like last month in the LTM

on the Treasury statement with 3.2 75
trillion this amount was 1.1 percent
lower than the 3.3 1 trillion reported
one year ago and is the third
consecutive month of annual receipt
declines this was the biggest drop since
the summer of 2008 at the same time
government spending rose by 3.8 percent
now you're listening to this and saying
well why is this all important well
every time since at least 1970 when
government receipts have turned negative
on an annual basis the u.s. was on the
cusp or already in a recession and the
last time government receipts turn
negative guess when that was July 2008
what does that tell you it tells us that
we've been in a recession we've been in
a recession since the beginning of last

all being covered up if we go back to

what's very interesting is that Japan

they're going to stop the drugs and when

they would draw they can't handle it
their system implodes that's what's

the central bank knew that this was

banks would have been shut down the
